items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: US markets remained shut on Thursday on account of Thanksgiving holiday, while Asian markets are trading in the red..

items.description: Stocks like James Warren Tea, Hinduja Global Solutions, PC Jeweller, PCBL, Bank of Baroda, Reliance Industries, PVP Ventures, and SPML Infra will also be in focus on November 29.

items.title: QIP fund raising crosses Rs 1 lakh crore mark for first time in a calendar year
items.description: Among the largest QIPs in 2024, Vedanta and Zomato led the way, each raising Rs 8,500 crore. They were followed by Adani Energy Solutions and Varun Beverages, which raised Rs 8,373 crore and Rs 7,500 crore, respectively.

items.title: Jefferies sees opportunity in Zomato's 'District' app; predicts 17% upside
items.description: Jefferies sees new use cases emerging for Zomato's going-out vertical in the coming time, presenting an opportunity for growth for the company.

items.title: Divi's Labs remains Citi's top pharma pick, sees 15% more upside
items.description: Citi remains bullish over Divi's expanding portfolio in its contrast media business, seeing the company as structurally as well as tactically well-positioned.

items.title: Live: Will Nifty Reclaim 24,000? Paytm, Zomato Among 45 New Stocks In F&O From Today |Opening Bell
items.description: The Nifty 50 decisively broke the three-day consolidation range of 24,100–24,350 on the downside and fell below the 24,000 mark, registering a 1.5% loss on the monthly F&O expiry session of November 28. If the index extends its downtrend, the level to watch is 23,600 (200-day EMA), but if it rebounds, resistance could be found in the 24,100–24,200 zone, according to experts. Meanwhile, 45 new stocks including Paytm, Zomato, BSE, Avenue Supermart and Jio Financial to be available for trade in the F&O segment from today. Also in focus will be Zee as shareholders reject proposal to re-Appoint Punit Goenka as Director. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Raja Venkatraman, Co-Founder NeoTrader and Deepak Ramaraju, Senior Fund Manager, Shriram AMC.

items.title: Sensex jumps over 400 pts, Nifty reclaims 24,000; pharma, energy stocks lead
items.description: In today's session, Nifty Energy and Pharma stocks rose 0.4- 1 percent in the opening trade. Gains Sun Pharma, Dr Reddy's, and Divis Labds lifted the index.

items.title: Newgen Software gains over 3% after securing Rs 32.45 crore RBI order
items.description: While Newgen delivered positive monthly returns from June to September, it faced a 4 percent decline in October and has dropped 10 percent so far in November.
